etymologies: mid 16th century (in the senses ‘physical extent’ and ‘grandeur’): from Latin amplitudo, from amplus ‘large, abundant’

definitions: the maximum extent of a vibration or oscillation, measured from the position of equilibrium

examples.text: waves with amplitudes greater than or equal to 20 mm

shortDefinitions: maximum extent of vibration or oscillation

definitions: the maximum difference of an alternating electrical current or potential from the average value

examples.text: the detection of signals only a few microvolts in amplitude

shortDefinitions: maximum difference of alternating electric current or potential from average value

definitions: the angular distance of a celestial object from the true east or west point of the horizon at rising or setting.
shortDefinitions: angular distance of celestial object from true east or west point of horizon

examples.text: the amplitude of the crime of manslaughter lies beneath murder

definitions: the angle between the real axis of an Argand diagram and a vector representing a complex number.
shortDefinitions: angle between real axis of Argand diagram
